data.value: Return a dictionary containing the underlying buffers. The returned dictionary has the following contents:     - "data": a two-element tuple whose first element is a buffer               containing the data and whose second element is the data               buffer's associated dtype.     - "validity": a two-element tuple whose first element is a buffer                   containing mask values indicating missing data and                   whose second element is the mask value buffer's                   associated dtype. None if the null representation is                   not a bit or byte mask.     - "offsets": a two-element tuple whose first element is a buffer                  containing the offset values for variable-size binary                  data (e.g., variable-length strings) and whose second                  element is the offsets buffer's associated dtype. None                  if the data buffer does not have an associated offsets                  buffer.
